reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were 3 adults staying at this hotel. The hotel is in an absolutely fantastic location. It is decorated with antiques so the hotel has that midevil charm. It is not a modern hotel however it fits in perfectly with the charm and feel of seville. The rooms were clean. There is a small pool on the roof with a bar. The staff was nice. I agree with the other reviewer that the rooms are noisy. You can hear other guests shutting doors, etc. We were able to WALK everywhere!!! Duplex is a great tapas place up the street!
reviews.title: Charming..Excellent Location!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very dated. Rooms are shabby and air conditioning is marginal, at best. We heard every noise in every room and outside of our room. Internet was not functioning in the rooms or in the common area the entire 3 days I was there. Staff is competent but not particularly friendly. Location is great, but that is the only positive.
reviews.title: Consistent reviews: bad facility/great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pitch perfect hotel; no more than a stumble to several café’s for a morning shot of espresso and breakfast.
reviews.title: Estupendo!

likes.liked: — The location, the rooftop pool and bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hop, skip or jump across the Plaza del Triunfo to the Cathedral, Giralda and main shopping street (Avenida de la Constitucion).
reviews.title: Least Favorite Hotel In Spain

likes.liked: — location, plaza, rooftop pool area, breakfast

reviews.title: Threadbare, but great location
reviews.text: Paseo to the numerous bars and restaurants that are 2 – 10 minutes away in the winding streets of the Barrio Santa Cruz.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Travelled with a few friends in October to what must be one if the best located hotels in Seville. With the Cathedral towering beside it and a short stroll to the beautiful Alcazar palace.
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We sat up on the roof in the evening enjoying the Sangria and the floodlit Giralda tower, what a spectacle.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

likes.disliked: — The decor was a bit dated, but not to the point of being shabby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our breakfast was included, food fine nothing spectacular. One of our rooms was on the side street overlooking bars and restaurants , a little noisy at night but not too bad. The other room overlooked a courtyard and was quieter, here the third bed was a problem not really suitable for an adult, so beware.
reviews.title: Best Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very helpful and friendly, plenty of information available on all the sights to visit. The open top bus tour was OK but better walking and exploring all the lanes and narrow streets, you just don't know what's around the next corner.
reviews.title: Loved it-again!
Class
reviews.text: Went to Flamenco show in El Arenal, show excellent but Tapas not really worth the extra you could pay, could find better food elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not too happy first night in room on 4th floor opposite pool bar and could hear air conditioning as well as people enjoying late drinks. We only had to ask the excellent reception staff who arranged transfer to another room when another room became available.
reviews.title: best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel and room cleaning service excellent. Hotel decor 'antiquish' but created special atmosphere. Cheaper breakfasts available outside hotel but for value and that extra cup of tea, and service, better sticking to hotel than going searching.
reviews.title: Fab Roof Terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Don't drive there get a taxi. The pool is not olympic standard but more than adequate to cool down and refresh. Just raise your glass to the hundreds who climb La Giralda - they must wish they could cool down in the heart of this magnificant city.
reviews.title: This is the one. Don't think of staying anywhere else in Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lasting impression? Lovely place and the staff really came out tops. I've already recommended Hotel Dona Maria to friends who are visiting Sevilla in October 06.
reviews.title: Had a great stay

likes.disliked: — Rooms were fine rather than great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Just got back from the Dona Maria. The location was great! Right across from the main cathedral and close to everything. Beautiful lobby and the roofdeck has great views and a pool, which was soooo nice to have after a hot day of sightseeing. Having drinks at night on the roofdeck is a perfect way to end the day. However, our room was tacky and felt like everything needed to be cleaned. And the walls are paper thin! You hear every movement from other rooms. It sounded like someone was either moving furniture or practicing line dancing all night long. I'd still recommend it for the pool and the location, but if you don't care about either, then you should look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great location, great pool, tacky room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located right on the cathedral square - could not be better - and perfect for access to sights restaurants bars etc. The building is architecturally of a piece with its surroundings, so has character, but the rooms have been modernised so are comfortable. Floors are wooden, which can make for some noise, but it was not a significant problems. Service was good. Overall, an excellent stay.
reviews.title: Superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, location, location - it really couldn't be better! you are right in the heart of the old quarter here (Santa cruz) and you really could throw a stone to the cathedral! The hotel as a wonderful rooftop garden, complete with (small) swimming pool and bar; although it seemed to close rather early, and the door was locked so no late night viewing of the surroundings :-( Seville is a fairly compact city, and easy for walking round (with a good map! - lots of narrow, twisting streets). But to see all the main sites (Cathedral, Real Alcazar) you won't find a better located hotel. Other sites (Bull ring, university area, etc). are just a few minutes walk away. We paid 150 Euro per night (3 nights) and overall, I don't think that's a bad price considering the location and hotel quality in general. Our room was decorated to a very high standard, with quality fittings and fixtures. But the air con unit did seem rather lack lustre... Only real dissapointment with room was that, due to the hotel layout, it had no external windows - only a window opening onto a internal service column, so no view whatsoever and could feel a little claustrophobic with the lack of a window. Although I guess this kept the noise level down.... Breakfast was not included in our rate, and the supplement (15 Euro per person) seemed rather steep; but there are plenty of places nearby to use as an alternative. There is no restaurant at the hotel, but as you are right in the middle of everything, finding somewhere to eat will not be a problem; round the corner is the street 'Mateos Gago' which has plenty of tapas bars to sample.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on a friday about 1:30 pm. Left first thing monday morning for the airport. Great location, but a very noisy hotel that appears to cater to tour groups. We asked for a quiet room and was given Room 312. This is actually the 4th floor. Room had two single beds that could not be pushed together. Room was directly below the pool on the next(4th floor). First nite the pool closed at 10:00 pm so it was noisy during the day. On saturday they closed the pool at 6:00 pm and then set it up for what seemed to be a wedding reception. Party went on till 2:00 am. Obviously no sleep.
reviews.title: A 4 star that should be a 3 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I asked the con. to make two reservations for me. One for friday dinner and one for saturday lunch. I tipped her 5 euro's. She confirmed in writing that both were made. Friday went fine.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Got back to the hotel and 1:30 pm for my 2:00 pm lunch reservation. A note at the front desk informed me that my lunch reservation was now canceled. After a series of phone calls the
reviews.title: Depends on what you want in a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: front desk infomed me that they overbooked and since they did not know me they decide to cancel my reservation. I asked the front desk if they recommended this place to their guests. They said yes, all the time. I stated that they obviously did not think much of this hotel if they decided to cancel a guest's reservation.
reviews.title: Best Located Hotel in Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If location is everything, then this is a great place - right next to the Cathedral. On the negative side, the rooms are basic to poor - though who really spends much time in the room. The staff was not helpful for us - though we speak littleSpanish and as you might expect they do not speak English. Most places we have traveled throughout Europe though, the staff will make an effort to communicate on a very basic level. The staff of the Donna Maria really made no effort to attempt communication. They seemed constantly irritated and confrontational. They initially sent us to a shabby smoking room - when we had clearly designated non-smoking. Sevilla is very nice and the hotel is perfectly located for exploring the sights - merely ignore the rooms and beware of the staff unless you have studied your Spanish.
reviews.title: Is location everything?

likes.liked: — All reviews will tell you - you can not beat the location
likes.disliked: — Quality of room - attitude of reception staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont get me wrong this hotel is a very nice hotel in a perfect location to explore the city of Seville. The layout of the hotel is nice and has a nice atmosphere. However, the service of the staff is appaling.
reviews.title: Great location but terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 3 night stay at the Dona Maria through hotels.com. When we arrived on the first night we were showed to a twin room even though we had booked a "special double" at a rate of £ 130 per night. We were expecting a nice room with a double bed possible with some extras i.e. balcony etc. The porter explained that in Spain a double room means two beds in the same room which is a load of rubbish. A double bed is a double bed anywhere in the world. We had no choice but to stay in the twin room for the first night as all other rooms were full.
reviews.title: Very happy here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The next day we moved to the room we should have been booked into (the special double) and we were much happier here.....until the morning. We were woken by major renovation works taking place in the hotel which we were not forewarned against. The banging and drilling started at 0800hrs and continued until 1900hrs - no lie ins or siestas for us !!! We came home from the holiday very tired as we hardly got any sleep whilst staying at the Dona Maria.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
